page.title: 16HEALTH SERVICES IN LEADENHAM
page.content: Leadenham is equidistant from two hospitals.12m.S.is the Grantham hospital.12m.N. is the Lincoln hospital. Both cover all aspects both medical and surgical,with day centres for the elderly.The Village is also served by a Group Practice whose surgery in Caythorpe,2m away,has 3 doctors and a nurse. A morning surgery is held each weekday and two evenings a week.An appointment system is used.On Wednesday pm there is an ante natal clinic.A Midwife and Health Visitor attend.Saturday surgery is for emergencies.Home visits are also made.Medecines are dispensed at the surgery as there is no local chemist.Ambulances are provided for hospital out patients unable to use public transport.The G.P. must recommend this service.If Home Nursing is required,there is a District Nurse.
